author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Director General of Police has issued a circular to all police officers in Tamil Nadu stating that they should not expose the identity of the accused or witness in an investigation to the media. He has warned that disciplinary action would be taken against them if they violate the order.

The circular by DGP Ashok Kumar states that some newspapers, on March 16, 2016, had published the photograph of accused involved in a murder case. It adds that the Madras High Court has taken serious view of this issue and has observed that publishing photographs of the accused in the media will hamper the test identification parade as witnesses could have a chance to see the accused in media before going to the parade and it will not have much evidentiary value.

Some newspapers published photograph of a murder accused recently
title: DGP warns officers
